oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1940-12-15 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: NBC syndication Sunday Down South, originating from WSM. Originally broadcast 1940-12-15, part 2. Personnel include Louie Buck (host), Kitty Kallen (performer), Paul Benson (performer), Beasley Smith (conductor, composer), and Owen Bradley (composer). Also mentioned as being on the show but not present in this part are Betty and the Dixie Dons (performer), and Mac McGar (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kitty Kallen; Paul Benson; Beasley Smith
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [Unidentified orchestral piece] -- Louie Buck introduces Kitty Kallen -- So You're The One (Kitty Kallen) -- Louie Buck talks -- [Unidentified orchestral piece] -- Louie Buck introduces Paul Benson -- Jeanie With The Light Brown Hair (Paul Benson) -- Louie Buck talks about Christmas -- Jingle Bells (orchestra) -- Theme (Thinking Of A Dream Down South) -- Closing statement (Louie Buck)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Sunday down south (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Smith, Beasley; Kallen, Kitty; Bradley, Owen; Beasley, Alcyone; Dixie Dons (Musical group); McGar, Mac
